testCases.explanation: At time 3, the path 0->2->3 or 0->1->3 is fully open. Minimum t is 3.
The path spirals outward; the bottleneck is the cell with value 16.
1x1 grid: already at destination with elevation 0.
Must pass through cell with value 3 at bottom-right. Minimum t is 3.
The top-left cell has elevation 3, which is the bottleneck to start.

description:
Solve the **Swim in Rising Water** problem.

You are in an n x n grid where grid[i][j] is the elevation. Rain starts and at time t, all cells with elevation <= t are flooded. Starting at (0,0), find the minimum time t such that there is a path from (0,0) to (n-1,n-1) through flooded cells using 4-directional movement.

See the full problem description on [LeetCode](https://leetcode.com/problems/swim-in-rising-water/).

examples.explanation: At time t=3 all cells are accessible and a path exists.
The bottleneck cell along the optimal path has elevation 16.

constraints: Each value in grid is unique
